name: notability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of being important and deserving attention, because of being very good or interesting: A restaurant has to have sufficient notability to be included in the guidebook. It was a burning desire for fame and notability that drove him on.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's rare that a minor character acquires such notability, but that's what has happened in her case.The company has achieved a certain degree of notability in the area for the excellent work they produce.Despite serving some awful beer and being very shabby, the pub has enjoyed notability for its associations with The Beatles.
